definitions.definition: To make invalid. Especially applied to contract law.
definitions.example: The circuit court judge's ruling was invalidated by a superior judge.

definitions.definition: To get upon; to ascend; to climb.
definitions.example: to mount stairs

definitions.definition: To place oneself on (a horse, a bicycle, etc.); to bestride.
definitions.example: The rider mounted his horse.

definitions.definition: To cause to mount; to put on horseback; to furnish with animals for riding.
To cause (something) to rise or ascend; to drive up; to raise; to elevate; to lift up.
To rise on high; to go up; to be upraised or uplifted; to tower aloft; to ascend; often with up.
To attach (an object) to a support, backing, framework etc.
definitions.example: to mount a mailbox on a post

definitions.definition: To attach (a drive or device) to the file system in order to make it available to the operating system.
(sometimes with up) To increase in quantity or intensity.
definitions.example: The bills mounted up and the business failed.  There is mounting tension in Crimea.

definitions.definition: To attain in value; to amount (to).
To get on top of (an animal) to mate.
To have sexual intercourse with someone.
To begin (a campaign, military assault, etc.); to launch.
definitions.example: The General gave the order to mount the attack.

definitions.definition: To deploy (cannon) for use.
definitions.example: to mount a cannon

definitions.definition: To prepare and arrange the scenery, furniture, etc. for use in (a play or production).
To incorporate fat, especially butter, into (a dish, especially a sauce to finish it).
definitions.example: Mount the sauce with one tablespoon of butter.

definitions.definition: Something mounted; an attachment.
The act of one who mounts.
That continues to mount; steadily accumulating.
definitions.example: mounting debts

definitions.definition: The exchange of opinions and advice especially in legal issues; consultation.
Exercise of judgment; prudence.
Advice; guidance.
Deliberate purpose; design; intent; scheme; plan.
A secret opinion or purpose; a private matter.
A lawyer, as in Queen's Counsel (QC).
To give advice, especially professional advice, to (somebody).
definitions.example: Psychiatrists, psychologists, social workers and other mental health professionals counsel clients.

definitions.definition: To recommend (a course of action).
definitions.example: I would counsel prudence in this matter.

definitions.definition: The vapor formed when water changes from liquid phase to gas phase.
Pressurized water vapour used for heating, cooking, or to provide mechanical energy.
Internal energy for motive power.
definitions.example: After three weeks in bed he was finally able to sit up under his own steam.

definitions.definition: Pent-up anger.
definitions.example: Dad had to go outside to blow off some steam.

definitions.definition: A steam-powered vehicle.
Travel by means of a steam-powered vehicle.
Any exhalation.
Fencing without the use of any electric equipment.
To cook with steam.
definitions.example: The best way to cook artichokes is to steam them.

definitions.definition: To expose to the action of steam; to apply steam to for softening, dressing, or preparing.
definitions.example: to steam wood or cloth

definitions.definition: To produce or vent steam.
To rise in vapour; to issue, or pass off, as vapour.
definitions.example: Our breath steamed in the cold winter air.

definitions.definition: To become angry; to fume; to be incensed.
To make angry.
definitions.example: It really steams me to see her treat him like that.

definitions.definition: To be covered with condensed water vapor.
definitions.example: With all the heavy breathing going on the windows were quickly steamed in the car.

definitions.definition: To travel by means of steam power.
definitions.example: The ship steamed out of the harbour

definitions.definition: To move with great or excessive purposefulness.
definitions.example: If he heard of anyone picking the fruit he would steam off and lecture them.

definitions.definition: To exhale.
Old-fashioned; from before the digital age.
Free from guile; honest but naive.
The section of a prison which houses those inmates who are sentenced to death.
Two similar or identical things taken together; often followed by of.
definitions.example: I couldn't decide which of the pair of designer shirts I preferred, so I bought the pair.

definitions.definition: Two people in a relationship, partnership or friendship.
definitions.example: Spouses should make a great pair.

definitions.definition: Used with binary nouns (often in the plural to indicate multiple instances, since such nouns are plural only, except in some technical contexts)
definitions.example: a pair of scissors; two pairs of spectacles; several pairs of jeans

definitions.definition: A couple of working animals attached to work together, as by a yoke.
definitions.example: A pair is harder to drive than two mounts with separate riders.

definitions.definition: A poker hand that contains two cards of identical rank, which cannot also count as a better hand.
A score of zero runs (a duck) in both innings of a two-innings match.
A double play, two outs recorded in one play.
definitions.example: They turned a pair to end the fifth.

definitions.definition: A doubleheader, two games played on the same day between the same teams
definitions.example: The Pirates took a pair from the Phillies.

definitions.definition: A boat for two sweep rowers.
A pair of breasts
definitions.example: She's got a gorgeous pair.

definitions.definition: The exclusion of one member of a parliamentary party from a vote, if a member of the other party is absent for important personal reasons.
Two members of opposite parties or opinion, as in a parliamentary body, who mutually agree not to vote on a given question, or on issues of a party nature during a specified time.
definitions.example: There were two pairs on the final vote.

definitions.definition: A number of things resembling one another, or belonging together; a set.

(kinematics) In a mechanism, two elements, or bodies, which are so applied to each other as to mutually constrain relative motion; named in accordance with the motion it permits, as in turning pair, sliding pair, twisting pair.
A special place (for hiding or viewing)
A spectacular mark (catch) in Australian rules football.
A reduction in consumer cost (usually for a limited time) for items or services rendered.
definitions.example: We're running a special on turkey for Thanksgiving.

definitions.definition: One of a rotation of meals systematically offered for a lower price at a restaurant.
definitions.example: Today's special is our tuna melt on rye.

definitions.definition: Unusual or exceptional episode of a series.
definitions.example: Did you see the Christmas special?

definitions.definition: A special constable.
Anything that is not according to normal practice, plan, or schedule, as an unscheduled run of transportation that is normally scheduled.
definitions.example: Thousands came to see the special that carried the President's coffin.

definitions.definition: Any unlicensed medicine produced or obtained for a specific individual patient.
A correspondent; a journalist sent to the scene of an event to report back.
A dispatch sent back by a special correspondent.
A light that illuminates a specific person or thing on the stage.
Someone who is an expert in, or devoted to, some specific branch of study or research.
A physician whose practice is limited to a particular branch of medicine or surgery.
Any of several non-commissioned ranks corresponding to that of corporal.
An organism that is specialized for a particular environment.
definitions.example: The tree Lepidothamnus laxifolius is a high alpine specialist found in high-altitude bog communities and in scrub.

definitions.definition: The act or process of specializing.
The area in which someone specializes.
The adaptation of an organism to a specific environment, or adaptation of an organ to a particular function.
A proof, axiom, problem, or definition whose cases are completely covered by another, broader concept.
definitions.example: A triangle is a specialization of a polygon to one with exactly three sides.

definitions.definition: An explicit set of requirements to be satisfied by a material, product, or service.
An act of specifying.
A person or thing that specifies.
A component of a phrase that is non-recursive and not found as a sister of the head of the phrase, but rather as a daughter of the maximal projection of the phrase.
A pair of lenses set in a frame worn on the nose and ears in order to correct deficiencies in eyesight or to ornament the face.
The process of thinking or meditating on a subject.
The act or process of reasoning a priori from premises given or assumed.
A conclusion to which the mind comes by speculating; mere theory; notion; conjecture.
An investment involving higher-than-normal risk in order to obtain a higher-than-normal return.

The act or practice of buying land, goods, shares, etc., in expectation of selling at a higher price, or of selling with the expectation of repurchasing at a lower price; a trading on anticipated fluctuations in price, as distinguished from trading in which the profit expected is the difference between the retail and wholesale prices, or the difference of price in different markets.
Examination by the eye; view.
Power of sight.
A card game in which the players buy from one another trumps or whole hands, upon a chance of getting the highest trump dealt, which entitles the holder to the pool of stakes.
The process of anticipating which branch of code will be chosen and executing it in advance.

A flat, pentagonal, rubber object placed at the center of the batter's box, which is used as a basis for judging pitched strikes and balls, and the touching of which by a runner advancing from or past third base scores a run.
To get over; to overcome.
To cap; to sit on top off.
Any land or marine reptile of the order Testudines, characterised by a protective shell enclosing its body. See also tortoise.
(specifically) A marine reptile of that order.
An Ancient Roman attack method, where the shields held by the soldiers hide them, not only left, right, front and back, but also from above.
A type of robot having a domed case (and so resembling the reptile), used in education, especially for making line drawings by means of a computer program.
An on-screen cursor that serves the same function as a turtle for drawing.
The curved plate in which the form is held in a type-revolving cylinder press.
A small element towards the end of a list of items to be bubble sorted, and thus tending to take a long time to be swapped into its correct position. Compare rabbit.
A breakdancing move consisting of a float during which the dancer's weight shifts from one hand to the other, producing rotation or a circular "walk".
A low stand for a lamp etc.
To flip over onto the back or top; to turn upside down.
To turn and swim upside down.
To hunt turtles, especially in the water.
To build up a large defense force and strike only punctually, rather than going for an offensive strategy.
A turtle dove.
The front; the forward part of something; the foreground.
definitions.example: The fore was painted white.

definitions.definition: Former; occurring earlier (in some order); previous.
definitions.example: the fore part of the day

definitions.definition: Forward; situated towards the front (of something).
definitions.example: the fore end of a wagon

definitions.definition: In the part that precedes or goes first; opposed to aft, after, back, behind, etc.
Formerly; previously; afore.
In or towards the bows of a ship.
An exclamation yelled to inform players a ball is moving in their direction.
To go, travel.
definitions.example: Behold! A knight fares forth.

definitions.definition: To get along, succeed (well or badly); to be in any state, or pass through any experience, good or bad; to be attended with any circumstances or train of events.
To eat, dine.
To happen well, or ill.
definitions.example: We shall see how it will fare with him.

definitions.definition: To move along; proceed; progress; advance
definitions.example: We will continue to monitor how the hurricane fares against projected models.

definitions.definition: A broad, shallow injury left by scraping (rather than a cut or a scratch).
definitions.example: He fell on the sidewalk and got a scrape on his knee.

definitions.definition: A fight, especially a fistfight without weapons.
definitions.example: He got in a scrape with the school bully.

definitions.definition: An awkward set of circumstances.
definitions.example: I'm in a bit of a scrape — I've no money to buy my wife a birthday present.

definitions.definition: A D and C or abortion; or, a miscarriage.
A shallow depression used by ground birds as a nest; a nest scrape.
A shallow pit dug as a hideout.
To draw (an object, especially a sharp or angular one), along (something) while exerting pressure.
definitions.example: Her fingernails scraped across the blackboard.

definitions.definition: To remove (something) by drawing an object along in this manner.
definitions.example: Scrape the chewing gum off with a knife.

definitions.definition: To injure or damage by rubbing across a surface.
definitions.example: She tripped on a rock and scraped her knee.

definitions.definition: To barely manage to achieve.
definitions.example: I scraped a pass in the exam.

definitions.definition: To collect or gather, especially without regard to the quality of what is chosen.
definitions.example: Just use whatever you can scrape together.

definitions.definition: To extract data by automated means from a format not intended to be machine-readable, such as a screenshot or a formatted web page.
To occupy oneself with getting laboriously.
definitions.example: He scraped and saved until he became rich.

definitions.definition: To play awkwardly and inharmoniously on a violin or similar instrument.
To draw back the right foot along the ground or floor when making a bow.
To express disapprobation of (a play, etc.) or to silence (a speaker) by drawing the feet back and forth upon the floor; usually with down.
One who believes in the politics or policies of the political right.
(in combination) One who supports the rights of a specified group.
definitions.example: an animal rightist

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to the political right.
Any species of game fish belonging to either of the genera Tetrapturus or Makaira. Every such species has a pointed, spear-like projection of the upper jaw.
To call up for consideration.
To make something happen earlier than originally planned.
definitions.example: The meeting has been brought forward by one day.

definitions.definition: A coat or skirt having such a hemline
Having a hemline at ankle length
A class of racing sailing yacht that pushes at the upper limits of the International Offshore Rule of regulated sail yacht racing, having a waterline length in excess of 70-feet.
A music single with more than two tracks, i.e. not just an A-side and a B-side.
A maxi boat
The highest limit
The greatest value of a set or other mathematical structure, especially the global maximum or a local maximum of a function
An upper bound of a set which is also an element of that set
The largest value of a batch or sample or the upper bound of a probability distribution
A 147 break; the highest possible break
A score of 180 with three darts
A scoring shot for 6 runs
Wrong or unjust
Unlawful or illegal
A grain used extensively in Europe for making bread, beer, and (now generally) for animal fodder.
The grass Secale cereale from which the grain is obtained.
Rye bread.
Rye whiskey.
Caraway (from the mistaken assumption that the whole seeds, often used to season rye bread, are the rye itself)
Ryegrass, any of the species of Lolium.
A disease of hawks.
Aggressive political or commercial promotion.
A mechanism which changes gears in a car.
A burn, or injury to the skin or flesh, by hot liquid or steam.
To burn with hot liquid.
definitions.example: to scald the hand

definitions.definition: To heat almost to boiling.
definitions.example: Scald the milk until little bubbles form.

definitions.definition: Scaliness; a scabby skin disease.
Affected with the scab; scabby.
Paltry; worthless.
A Nordic poet of the Viking Age
definitions.example: 1913, Henry Bedford-Jones, Flamehair the Skald: A Tale of the Days of Hardrede, passim.

definitions.definition: To separate, detach, or isolate.
To separate a body or material from others, e.g. by non-conductors to prevent the transfer of electricity, heat, etc.
definitions.example: Ceramic can be used to insulate power lines.

definitions.definition: Protected from heat, cold, noise etc, by being surrounded with an insulating material.
Placed or set apart.
definitions.example: an insulated house or column

definitions.definition: (of an electrically conducting material) Isolated or separated from other conducting materials, or sources of electricity.
definitions.example: Early insulated wires were covered in silk rather than plastic.

definitions.definition: Situated at so great a distance as to be beyond the effect of gravitation; said of stars supposed to be so far apart that the effect of their mutual attraction is undetectable.
Any instrument used to gather or take by dragging; as:
Very fine mineral matter held in suspension in water.
To make a channel deeper or wider using a dredge.
To bring something to the surface with a dredge.
(Usually with up) to unearth.
definitions.example: to dredge up someone's unsavoury past

definitions.definition: A large shaker for sprinkling spices or seasonings during food preparation.
To sprinkle (food) with spices or seasonings, using a dredge.
definitions.example: Dredge the meat with the flour mixture you prepared earlier.

definitions.definition: A mixture of oats and barley.
To place inside.
definitions.example: Just put in the key for the ignition and turn it.

definitions.definition: To apply, request, or submit.
definitions.example: I'm going to the bank to put in for a transfer.

definitions.definition: To contribute.
definitions.example: Despite his success, the comedian liked to put in appearances at some of the smaller venues.

definitions.definition: To call at (a place or port), especially as a deviation from an intended journey.
The principal female singer or the leading lady.
A person who considers himself or herself much more important than others, has high expectations of others and becomes angry when his or her standards or demands are not met.
A service used for the transmission of breaking news to the media or to the public
A tiny opening in the skin.
By extension any small opening or interstice, especially one of many, or one allowing the passage of a fluid.
To study meticulously; to go over again and again.
To meditate or reflect in a steady way.
A female responsible for getting the balls from off the area of play to the players.
A feeling of dislike (normally towards someone, less often towards something); repugnance or distaste.
Natural contrariety or incompatibility
definitions.example: oil and water have antipathy

definitions.definition: A dog of various breeds originally developed to hunt wolves.
A joint of the horse's leg below the knee or hock and above the hoof.
The tuft of hair that grows at this joint.
A thin, pointed, projecting part, as of an antler or a fork or similar tool. A tine.
definitions.example: a pitchfork with four prongs

definitions.definition: A branch; a fork.
definitions.example: the two prongs of a river

definitions.definition: The penis.
To pierce or poke with, or as if with, a prong
To apply a means test to an individual or group.
(authorship) A gap or inconsistency in a storyline that goes against the flow of logic established by the story's plot.
One who has received the highest of the four minor orders in the Catholic Church, being ordained to carry the wine, water and lights at Mass.
An altar server.
An attendant, assistant or follower.
An inauguration; a formal beginning.
definitions.example: The inaugural of the President will take place in March.

definitions.definition: A formal speech given at the beginning of an office.
Of inauguration; as in a speech or lecture by the person being inaugurated.
Marking the beginning of an operation, venture, etc.
definitions.example: 2009 was the inaugural season for New York Yankees' new stadium.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to obstetrics (the care of women during and after pregnancy).
definitions.example: obstetric clinic

definitions.definition: A catecholamine hormone and neurotransmitter; as a hormone, secreted by the adrenal gland in response to stress (when it stimulates the autonomic nervous system); as a neurotransmitter, synthesized from norepinephrine.
The breastbone
The sclerotized plate of spiders, between the coxae, marking the floor of the cephalothorax
To convince (someone) by talking and suggesting
definitions.example: At the beginning, I wasn't keen on working the weekend shift, but my boss talked me into it.

definitions.definition: To deny the truth of (a statement or statements).
definitions.example: His testimony contradicts hers.

definitions.definition: To deny the truth of the statement(s) made by (a person).
definitions.example: Everything he says contradicts me.

definitions.definition: To be contrary to (something).
To give an order contrary to (another order or wish), oppose (something).
To give an order contrary to one given by (another person), oppose or resist (someone).
To speak against; to forbid.

A mark consisting of (in English) three periods, historically or more formally with spaces in between, before, and after them “ . . . ”, or more recently a single character “…” Ellipses are used to indicate that words have been omitted in a text or that they are missing or illegible.
(grammar) The omission of a word or phrase that can be inferred from the context.
The omission of scenes in a film that do not advance the plot.
An ellipse.
Any of several subdued tints of colors, usually associated with pink, peach, yellow, green, blue and lavender
A drawing made with any of those colors.
A type of dried paste used to make crayons.
A crayon made from such a paste.
Woad.
definitions.example: Wool was dyed in the pastel vat.

definitions.definition: A traditional dish in various Latin American countries, resembling a tamale, pasty, or calzone.
(of a project etc) Not coordinated or properly planned
(of body movement) Lacking coordination
(originally rhetorical) A rhetorical device in which a series is arranged in ascending order.
An instance of such an ascending series.
The culmination of a narrative's rising action, the turning point.
(now commonly) A culmination or acme: the last term in an ascending series, particularly:
To reach or bring to a climax.
To orgasm; to reach orgasm.
Capsicum annuum, an edible spicy-sweet fruit, originating in the New World.
To cook with steam.
definitions.example: The best way to cook artichokes is to steam them.

definitions.definition: To expose to the action of steam; to apply steam to for softening, dressing, or preparing.
definitions.example: to steam wood or cloth

definitions.definition: To produce or vent steam.
To rise in vapour; to issue, or pass off, as vapour.
definitions.example: Our breath steamed in the cold winter air.

definitions.definition: To become angry; to fume; to be incensed.
To make angry.
definitions.example: It really steams me to see her treat him like that.

definitions.definition: To be covered with condensed water vapor.
definitions.example: With all the heavy breathing going on the windows were quickly steamed in the car.

definitions.definition: To travel by means of steam power.
definitions.example: The ship steamed out of the harbour

definitions.definition: To move with great or excessive purposefulness.
definitions.example: If he heard of anyone picking the fruit he would steam off and lecture them.

definitions.definition: To exhale.
The action of steam on something.
The method of cooking by immersion in steam.
A form of robbery in which a large gang moves swiftly and violently through a bus, train, etc.; see Steaming (crime).
Relating to the ability of a steam locomotive (etc.) to raise steam.
Giving off steam.
definitions.example: We were served with steaming bowls of soup.

definitions.definition: Very angry.
definitions.example: I was steaming when I heard about their betrayal.

definitions.definition: Extremely drunk.
The part of a road that carries traffic.
(grammar) reported speech
(sometimes proscribed) To tweet; to post an update to Twitter.
The sound of a succession of chirps as uttered by birds.
definitions.example: I often listen to the twitter of the birds in the park.

definitions.definition: A tremulous broken sound.
A slight trembling of the nerves.
Unwanted flicker that occurs in interlaced displays when the image contains vertical detail that approaches the horizontal resolution of the video format.
To utter a succession of chirps.
(of a person) To talk in an excited or nervous manner.
To make the sound of a half-suppressed laugh; to titter; to giggle.
To have a slight trembling of the nerves; to be excited or agitated.
To twit; to reproach or upbraid.
Towards the source of a river.
Towards the source of a river.
Against the current.
A food made of ground meat (or meat substitute) and seasoning, packed in a section of the animal's intestine, or in a similarly cylindrical shaped synthetic casing; a length of this food.
A sausage-shaped thing.
Penis.
A term of endearment.

definitions.definition: A saucisse.
To form a sausage-like shape, with a non-uniform cross section.
(especially of a woman) fairly short and of slim build.
(clothing) of small size.
Small, little; insignificant; petty.
A storm in which there are strong, violent winds but no precipitation.
To listen without participating.
definitions.example: Do you mind if I listen in on your meeting tomorrow?

definitions.definition: To eavesdrop; to listen secretly.
definitions.example: You should close the door for conversations like that. You never know who might be listening in.

definitions.definition: A shot that passes the opponent because it is out of reach
Of, relating to, or designating a disease or condition having no known cause.
A racetrack with optimum conditions for high speeds
A railroad for express trains.
The quickest or most direct method or path.
definitions.example: Google welcomes the decision to not approve the fast track of Microsoft's OOXML.

definitions.definition: A high-pressure or intensely competitive situation, particularly one characterised by rapid advancement.
To progress something with unusual rapidity.
definitions.example: The head of Sydney Airport thinks frequent flyers should be fast-tracked through security checks.

definitions.definition: Any of many plant diseases causing damage to, or the death of, leaves, fruit or other parts.
The bacterium, virus or fungus that causes such a condition.
(by extension) Anything that impedes growth or development or spoils any other aspect of life.
To affect with blight; to blast; to prevent the growth and fertility of.
To suffer blight.
definitions.example: This vine never blights.

definitions.definition: To spoil or ruin (something).
definitions.example: Those obscene tattoos are going to blight your job prospects.

definitions.definition: (of a person or animal) Unable to distinguish between two or more primary colors (usually red and green).
(of a person or process) Holding no prejudice based on skin color or race; not paying attention to skin color.
(in plural) Interchangeable things or terms.
A convertible car: a car with a removable or foldable roof able to convert from a closed to open vehicle and back again.
A convertible security: a stock, bond, etc. that can be turned into another (usually common stock) under certain set terms.
A computer able to convert from laptop to tablet and back again.
Able to be converted, particularly:
A major repair, remake, renovation, or revision.
definitions.example: The engine required a complete overhaul to run properly.

definitions.definition: The process after the fire appears extinguished in which the firefighters search the structure for signs of hot spots that may cause the structure to reignite. Often this includes the process of salvage under the blanket term, salvage and overhaul.
To modernize, repair, renovate, or revise completely.
To pass, overtake, or travel past.
To keep (running rigging) clear, and see that no hitch occurs.
To search (a ship) for contraband goods.
(of a person or remark) With subtle hostility in an effort to hurt, annoy or upset, particularly among women.
Resembling or characteristic of a cat.
definitions.example: a catty smell

definitions.definition: A (unit of) weight used in China, generally standardized as half a kilogram.
Confinement of a person to his or her residence, sometimes with a limited travel allowance, ordered by a judge or other authority as a more lenient alternative to imprisonment.
(of clothing) Made of a reflective or fluorescent material that can be easily seen.
Denoting something intended to attract attention and be noticed.
A system of trading promoting more equitable global trade, especially to sellers and producers in poorer areas, but also to the environment.
An old, dilapidated or unpretentious automobile.
A hip, cool, groovy automobile.
An act of hesitating
Doubt; vacillation.
definitions.example: She carried out the order without hesitation.

definitions.definition: A faltering in speech; stammering.
Any food-borne disease, such as salmonella, which causes diarrhea, nausea, fever and abdominal cramps.
Someone who plays the cello.
Anything that cannot be attained.
Impossible to attain or reach; unable to accomplish
Depending on the throw of a die; random, arising by chance.
Of or pertaining to works that have been produced with an element of chance (aleatoricism).
A seasoned, often acidic liquid mixture in which food is marinated, or soaked, usually to flavor and prepare it for cooking.
definitions.example: I like to use a lemon marinade with chicken.

definitions.definition: To marinate.
Facial hair on the chin, cheeks, jaw and neck.
The cluster of small feathers at the base of the beak in some birds.
The appendages to the jaw in some cetaceans, and to the mouth or jaws of some fishes.
The byssus of certain shellfish.
The gills of some bivalves, such as the oyster.
In insects, the hairs of the labial palpi of moths and butterflies.
Long or stiff hairs on a plant; the awn.

definitions.definition: A barb or sharp point of an arrow or other instrument, projecting backward to prevent the head from being easily drawn out.
The curved underside of an axehead, extending from the lower end of the cutting edge to the axehandle.
That part of the underside of a horse's lower jaw which is above the chin, and bears the curb of a bridle.
That part of a type which is between the shoulder of the shank and the face.
A fake customer or companion, especially a woman who accompanies a gay man in order to give the impression that he is heterosexual.
To grow hair on the chin and jaw.
To boldly and bravely oppose or confront, often to the chagrin of the one being bearded.
definitions.example: Robin Hood is always shown as bearding the Sheriff of Nottingham.

definitions.definition: To take by the beard; to seize, pluck, or pull the beard of (a man), in anger or contempt.
To deprive (an oyster or similar shellfish) of the gills.
Of a gay man or woman: to accompany a gay person of the opposite sex in order to give the impression that they are heterosexual.
